comment.b: If you attend one of these events... look me up!

event-entry.title: XP2018
event-entry.precis: I will be facilitating the Open Space at XP2018. This will be the fifteenth XP Conference I've taken part in and I highly recommend it for anyone who is serious about Agile in any of it's forms, but especially XP.

event-entry.title: Italian Agile Days
event-entry.precis: Thanks to the Italian Agile community for the great welcome I received! It was my first time giving a keynote in Italian and although it was rough in places, folks were tolerant and really seemed to get the message about getting "Back to Basics". This community seems very strong and are ready to revitalize their practice of Agile!

event-entry.title: XP Day France 2006
event-entry.precis: The well known XP-Day format in French! This is the first French XP-Day, sponsored by the XP-France group. I'll be giving a keynote on XP as a source of business value.

event-entry.title: XP2006
event-entry.precis: This year, I'm organizing the Open Space.

event-entry.title: Consultants Network and Retreat
event-entry.precis: An annual consultants retreat on the Oregon coast. I attended for the first time time last year and I'm looking forward to this one as well.

event-entry.title: XP2005
event-entry.precis: I presented a tutorial on Test Driven User Interfaces.

event-entry.precis: A talk about new NUnit features and Test-Driven Development in general.

event-entry.title: Agile Scotland SIG
event-entry.precis: I spoke to a lively audience on the topic "When Tests Seem Hard" describing strategies for using "hard to test" situations as opportunities to improve design.

event-entry.title: Consultants Network and Retreat
event-entry.precis: Thanks to an invitation from Diana Larsen, I'm participating with this small group of consultants holding their annual retreat on the Oregon coast. I'm looking forward to meeting everyone!

event-entry.title: OOPSLA 2004
event-entry.precis: Participating in several workshops.

event-entry.title: Scrum Gathering
event-entry.precis: Ken Schwaber is getting a group together for two days to talk about Scrum. I'm especially interested in how Scrum relates to the techniques and tools used by other agile methods.

event-entry.title: XP Agile Universe 2004
event-entry.precis: I'm participating in two workshops: Who Should Write Acceptance Tests and Refactoring Our Writings. I'm also planning for an Open Space session on agile tools for .NET, to following up on a similar session I held at XP2004. Other than that, look for me around the conference, starting on Saturday afternoon.

event-entry.title: .NET Developers Association
event-entry.precis:
I'll be talking about unit/programmer testing, test-driven development and NUnit, featuring the new 2.2 release. This presentation is on the Microsoft campus: be sure to bring a printed copy of the
meeting announcement and a picture id in order to be admitted.

event-entry.title: Communicating Through Tests
event-entry.precis: This workshop, originally developed and presented jointly with Ward Cunningham, is centered around the notion of tests as an agile communication medium. It features both unit and acceptance testing on multiple platforms. The link is partly Swedish, partly English.

event-entry.title: SPIN-Sweden
event-entry.precis: Two talks at the kickoff meeting for a new SPIN group: "Value, Competency and Cooperation in Software Development" and "Test-Driven Development".
